mediaList.caption: Niet hier gaan eten. Moesten €15,34 EXTRA btw betalen bovenop de normale prijzen die vermeld waren op de menukaart en het bord buiten. Belachelijk, nog nooit meegemaakt!

reviews.title: Simple little place at the beginning of the shopping street
reviews.text:
Small restaurant at the beginning of the shopping area :)
The service was friendly:)
On the menu are various fish dishes, from plaice to kibbeling to shrimp.
Interior a bit wild.

reviews.title: Unfortunately not what we expected
reviews.text: For a decent price a fork pricked here. Didn't taste very much. Menu not too big. Friendly waitress.

reviews.title: Tricked ..
reviews.text: Don't eat here. On top of the bill suddenly came extra €15.34 VAT , see photo. The normal prices were listed on the menu and the sign outside on the terrace. Never experienced anything like it. Ridiculous!

photo.caption: Niet hier gaan eten. Moesten €15,34 EXTRA btw betalen bovenop de normale prijzen die vermeld waren op de menukaart en het bord buiten. Belachelijk, nog nooit meegemaakt!

reviews.title: Worst hell restaurant
reviews.text: Worst fish I've ever eaten, gourmet was cooked from the inside and not fried awful. These people are killing people with cooked fish. Unfriendly staff and you are looked at very crookedly for nothing! Terrible really not recommended it is hell!

tips.body: Een hel restaurant , lekkerbek gaar slechte service

reviews.title: Could be better
reviews.text: We were kindly helped by the girl from the ministry. However, the food did not meet our expectations. The fish had little taste and the chips were fried for too long. Inside it didn't really look hygienic either. Better next time I hope!

reviews.title: Frying pan
reviews.text: What a travesty 18 euros for a little fried, well what was it anyway? You get better quality fish at the fish stall on the market. Kitchen did not look completely hygienic. All in all a very disappointing (something to do with fish) business with so much sea 100 meters away. You could have done something with that.

tips.body: Ga niet. Blijf weg ga ergens anders lekker eten

reviews.title: Run through
reviews.text: We were in Harlingen for a few days and went there to eat terrible fish. We think it was a group of friends sitting there with a can. Has nothing to do with restaurant. It's also not really clean and really unpleasant.

reviews.title: Good value and freshly cooked fish and chips.
reviews.text:
Good value freshly cooked fish dishes.
Friendly helpful proprietors and service.
Best chips so far in the Netherlands.

reviews.title: A fish and chips lunch in Harlingen
reviews.text: This restaurant is more cafe/cafetaria like. But the fish and chips were crispy and tasty, the salad was crispy fresh.  The service isn't very customer focussed, just not un friendly. When we were there, it seems there were friends, with young children, of the chef sitting at a tble near the counter, the focus was to them and hardly to us as customer. So we had some problems to choose because we didn't know the differences between some dishes. Finally, what we got was good, but the restaurant isn't a realy fish restaurant but more a cafetaria with a wider product choise.

reviews.title: Much better than we expected
reviews.text:
Friendly service and very good value for money. We had two specials of the day ( plaice/schol in dutch) for 12.50 euro each. (One fillet the other untouched). The a la carte plates were all very reasonably priced. The plaices were excellently fried, and served with fries and salad. 
Higly recommend

reviews.title: Stay away
reviews.text: This place looked quite nice on the first glimpse. But the staff was extremely unfriendly, getting drinks took very long and after an hour we still didn’t have our food - we ordered simple fast food. People around had similar issues. When I went inside to ask about the food I notice how messy the kitchen looked. No apology from the staff on letting us wait. We canceled the food went to a shop around the corner which was awesome! Would never ever go back to this place.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!
Plan your perfect day trip from Berlin.

articleContent.title: 10 best non-touristy things to do in London

seoInfo.metaDescription: There’s more to the UK capital than Big Ben and the Tower of London. Here are some of our favorite non-touristy London experiences.

articleContent.title: 13 can’t-miss Harry Potter filming locations and tours in London
What to wear in Dubai: 8 essential items to pack and foolproof outfits for every situation

seoInfo.metaDescription: When you're traveling, it's important to be prepared for any situation. Here are 8 items to pack on your next trip to Dubai, that'll bring you from desert safari to the city's best night clubs.

articleContent.title: Taste the World in One City: Washington, D.C.

seoInfo.metaDescription: A guide to Washington D.C.'s global gastronomy, from Sichuan to Salvadoran restaurants.

articleContent.title: Celebrate the best of Osaka’s food and nightlife with Suntory

seoInfo.metaDescription: If you’ve ever found yourself standing in line for hours at a famous ramen spot in Japan, you’d probably agree that food and drinks are a big part of why we travel. It’s one of the best ways to get a glimpse into a destination's culture, traditions, and history, whether it’s through its local dishes, ingredients, or culinary customs. But if you really want to embrace local culture, there’s no better way than over a glass. Share a drink with locals, friends, and fellow travelers, and experience the camaraderie, stories, and traditions that make up the heart of a destination, forging deeper connections along the way.

articleContent.title: The many pathways to peace in Hiroshima

seoInfo.metaDescription: Nestled in the southwestern part of Japan’s Honshu Island, Hiroshima Prefecture is embraced by the azure waters of the Seto Inland Sea. More than a destination, Hiroshima is a haven for those yearning to escape into a realm of beauty and tranquillity mixed with cultural richness. In Hiroshima, time slows and beckons you to linger longer, savouring not just the picturesque scenery but also a diverse array of peaceful yet uplifting experiences. You’ll uncover a profound sense of spiritual and emotional connection, whether in well-known tourist spots or the often-overlooked wonders that quietly await discovery. Within the depths of this immersive journey, a sense of inner calm reveals itself.
